data: Dr. Albert T. Rosenberger Dr. Albert T. Rosenberger Professor and Graduate Coordinator Ph.D., University of Illinois, 1979 222 Physical Sciences 405-744-6742 atr@okstate.edu or physics.grad.coordinator@okstate.edu Lab: 551-552 Physical Sciences, 405-744-3849 Optical Physics Laboratory AB, Whitman College, 1971 SM, University of Chicago, 1972 PhD, University of Illinois, Urbana, 1979 American Physical Society Outstanding Referee, 2008 Research Interests Dr. Rosenberger’s Optical Physics Laboratory is currently involved in studies of the optics of microresonators. In addition to the basic physics of dielectric microresonators, research topics include chemical and surface-effect sensing, classical analogs to quantum-optical phenomena, quantum-dot microlasers, measurement of thermal accommodation coefficients, evanescent coupling enhancement, and plasmonics. More detailed information can be found by following the Optical Physics Laboratory link above.
